main event: An unidentified flying object was observed in Petersburg, Virginia on August 25, 1952, for approximately 6 seconds. The object was reported to be very fast and changed direction.
interesting points: The sighting took place in Petersburg, Virginia, with the object remaining in sight for a short duration of 6 seconds.
The observation was categorized as a Ground-Visual type with no photographs available for documentation.
The conclusion drawn from the evaluation was that it was likely a balloon, although no further details were provided for the sighting.
The witness, Mr. Garrell Clerk, was a member of the Ground Observer Corps under the Richmond, Virginia Filter Center.
The report indicates that the sighting was submitted late due to the unavailability of information.
witnesses: Reliability and experience unknown except for Mr. Garrell Clerk, a member of the Ground Observer Corps under the Richmond, Virginia Filter Center
